review: I pre-ordered before it was released and got it for the great price of 19.99.  It's great for your Amazon Prime viewing and there are some cool mini games that you can actually control with this itsy bitsy remote that's a nice feature.  There is also access to your cloud photos which I have none at the time so I can't comment on how that works, but it's a nice feature.  There are some cooking apps available for download, they all suck badly.Outside of Amazon related apps, so products like YouTube, Netflix and some of the other streamed software options run poorly and slowly compared to the Amazon Prime. It is a noticeable step down in performance compared to my PS3, Vizio smart TVs, and even a 10 year old HP Pavilion running on windows XP.There are some cool mini games that you can actually control with this itsy bitsy remote that's a nice feature.

review: I purchased the fire tv stick to use with my fire hd 6 and Amazon prime.  It works great with wifi (especially when compared to other streaming devices I've tried) and I really like that it can be controlled by my Fire or the remote that came with it.  Also use it with Netflix app which works smoothly on it.  There's lots more that can be done with this device that I'm sure works just as well. I would highly recommend the fire tv stick, especially if someone has a prime account.
